conclusion: Objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F, coming into contact with them due to gravity.
Objects A and B will fall straight downward because of gravity.
As objects A and B reach the table, each top cloth will drape over whatever rigid shape happens to be underneath it.
The cloth covering C and D (left side) will sag until it touches the pink block C first, and then the taller yellow block D.
The cloth covering E and F (right side) will sag until it touches the slanted white-blue block E first, and then the taller solid blue block F.
Once the cloths are fully settled, the lower parts of the cloths will be resting directly on the tops and vertical faces of the blocks.
No further motion occurs after the cloths come to rest; the blocks simply stay hidden under the cloths.

Final answer: Each cloth falls, drapes itself over the blocks beneath it, and comes to rest with its lowest points lying on the upper surfaces of the corresponding blocks (C & D on the left, E & F on the right).
